channel.title: New Dad WLA
channel.itunes:author: WonderAI
channel.description:
Join the adventure of modern fatherhood in the heart of West Los Angeles, where museum visits trump beach days and food trucks compete with fine dining. This fresh take on millennial parenting drops you right into the action, offering practical advice and relatable stories for dads navigating the unique landscape of raising kids in LA's cultural hub.
From discovering hidden gem restaurants perfect for toddlers to mastering the art of weekend cultural excursions, this podcast delivers insider tips and real-world solutions for fathers who prefer gallery openings to surf lessons. Each episode immerses you in authentic parenting scenarios, tackling everything from choosing the right family-friendly concerts to finding quiet moments in the city's most beloved museums.
Disclaimer: This description is experimental and was generated by AI. It may contain factual errors.
channel.itunes:summary: A millennial dads guide to raising culturally engaged kids in Los Angeles through food and museum adventures.

itunes:category.text: Kids & Family > Parenting, Arts > Food, Arts > Performing Arts

item.title: Potty Training at the Getty: A Modern Parent's Museum Guide
item.itunes:title: Potty Training at the Getty: A Modern Parent's Museum Guide
item.description:
In this illuminating episode of New Dad WLA, we delve into the intricate world of potty training while navigating Los Angeles's cultural landscape. From the sun-drenched Getty Center to the halls of LACMA, discover practical strategies for maintaining an active lifestyle during this crucial developmental phase. The episode unveils groundbreaking research from the Toilet Training Readiness Scale, offering evidence-based insights that challenge traditional age-based approaches. Learn how to transform museum visits into strategic training opportunities through innovative techniques like art-based scavenger hunts and visual cuing systems. The discussion explores family-friendly facilities at LA's premier cultural institutions, including insider tips about optimal restroom locations and amenities. Drawing from recent pediatric guidelines, the episode addresses the flexible nature of the training window (18-42 months) while providing practical solutions for parents balancing cultural enrichment with potty training challenges. Whether you're planning visits to the Getty, Hammer Museum, or LACMA, this essential guide offers valuable insights for turning potential stress points into opportunities for both learning and cultural exploration.
Further Reading: • 'Oh Crap! Potty Training: Everything Modern Parents Need to Know' - Book (https://amazon.com/dp/1501122983) • 'The First-Time Parent's Guide to Potty Training' - Book (https://amazon.com/dp/1641524235) • 'Cultural Institutions and Family Accessibility' (https://www.getty.edu/visit/families) • 'New Research on Toilet Training Readiness' (https://www.aap.org/toilet-training-guidelines)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.
item.itunes:summary: Potty training in LA's cultural spaces: innovative strategies for museum visits and child development
